item.title: Robots Will Steal Our Jobs, But They'll Give Us New Ones
item.description:
Robots Will Steal Our Jobs, But They'll Give Us New Ones

At the Dusseldorf airport, robotic valet parking is now reality. You step out of your car. You press a button on a touch screen. And then a machine lifts your car off the ground, moving all three tons of it into a kind of aerial parking bay.

item.title: Machine Intelligence In The Real World
item.description:
Machine Intelligence In The Real World

I've been laser-focused on machine intelligence in the past few years. I've talked to hundreds of entrepreneurs, researchers and investors about helping machines make us smarter. In the months since I shared my landscape of machine intelligence companies, folks keep asking me what I think of them - as if they're all doing more or less the same thing.

item.title: MIT uses artificial intelligence to predict online learning drop outs | ZDNet
item.description:
MIT uses artificial intelligence to predict online learning drop outs | ZDNet

MIT said it has begun using artificial intelligence and big data techniques to better predict which students will drop out from open online courses. The news, which was detailed at a conference on artificial intelligence in education last week, is notable for a few reasons.

item.title: Bill Gates and Elon Musk are wrong: Artificial intelligence is not going to take over the world
item.description:
Bill Gates and Elon Musk are wrong: Artificial intelligence is not going to take over the world

This article originally appeared on AlterNet. There's been a lot of chatter in the past year about the menace of artificial intelligence. This summer's movie season offered four films featuring major AI characters, most recently Terminator Genisys, but also Avengers: Age of Ultron, Ex Machina, and Chappie.
